skill.name: scaffolding-openai-agents
skill.description:
Builds AI agents using OpenAI Agents SDK with async/await patterns and multi-agent orchestration.
Use when creating tutoring agents, building agent handoffs, implementing tool-calling agents, or orchestrating multiple specialists.
Covers Agent class, Runner patterns, function tools, guardrails, and streaming responses.
NOT when using raw OpenAI API without SDK or other agent frameworks like LangChain.

No malicious code, no credential access, no network exfiltration, no persistence mechanisms. content.value_statement: Creating AI agents from scratch requires understanding async patterns, tool integration, and multi-agent handoffs. This skill provides production-ready scaffolding patterns so you can focus on your agent logic instead of boilerplate code.
actual_capabilities: Scaffold Agent class with custom instructions and model settings
Implement async/await patterns with Runner for single and streaming requests
Build multi-agent systems with handoffs for specialist routing
Add input and output guardrails for content validation
Inject shared context across agent interactions
limitations: Only supports OpenAI Agents SDK, not LangChain or other frameworks
Does not cover raw OpenAI API calls without the SDK
API key management must be handled separately
Does not include deployment or hosting configurations

best_practices: Always use async/await patterns with Runner.run() for scalable agent execution
Mark agents with clear handoff descriptions for effective routing in multi-agent systems
Use Pydantic models with output_type for guaranteed structured JSON responses
Implement guardrails early to validate inputs and prevent unwanted outputs
anti_patterns: Do not use eval() in function tools for expression evaluation - use safe_eval or math libraries instead
Do not skip input validation - always validate user content before processing
Do not hardcode API keys - use environment variables for credentials

faq.question: What is the difference between handoffs and agents as tools?
faq.answer: Handoffs transfer full conversation control to another agent. Agents as tools let one agent call another as a subtask while maintaining control.

faq.question: How do I handle streaming responses in production?
faq.answer: Use Runner.run_streamed() and iterate through stream_events() to yield deltas in real-time for your FastAPI streaming response.

faq.question: Is my data sent to OpenAI when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, agents send inputs to OpenAI for processing. Review OpenAI data policy for compliance requirements before deployment.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude instead of GPT models?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for OpenAI Agents SDK. For Claude agents, use Claude-specific agent frameworks or API integrations.

faq.question: How do I prevent the agent from giving complete solutions?
faq.answer: Use output_guardrails to scan responses for solution indicators and trigger a tripwire when detected.

faq.question: What is the safest way to evaluate mathematical expressions in tools?
faq.answer: Use the math library or ast.literal_eval for safe expression evaluation. Never use eval() with untrusted input.
